intro: Coccoloba hotteana, commonly known as the Trinidadian coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean, particularly found in Trinidad and Tobago, as well as parts of South America. The plant is a shrub or small tree, typically growing up to 5 meters in height, with smooth, dark green leaves that have a slightly waxy texture. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or red, and it produces small, round berries that are edible. Coccoloba hotteana is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and adaptability to various soil types.
